DOCNAME: FREIHEITLICHE PARTEI ÖSTERREICHS, LANDESGRUPPE NIEDERÖSTERREICH v. AUSTRIA
TEXT: The applicant , ORG , PERSON is the regional branch of ORG in GPE . It is represented before ORG by PERSON , ORG , lawyers practising in GPE .
In DATE Mr PERSON , deputy mayor of ORG and member of ORG of ORG ( ORG ) , published in the municipality ’s party magazine “ ORG ” , inter alia , the following phrase :

“ They are sitting in ORG where a minister really ought to work for the benefit of the Land , but instead they are sabotaging the work of the Land from within ORG . ( PERSON in GPE , PERSON in GPE ) . ”

Subsequently , PERSON , Minister of ORG ( NORP PERSON ) , lodged injunction proceedings under LAW ( ORG ) against PERSON . The proceedings were settled with the following disclaimer published by PERSON in the above party magazine :

“ I wrote in the DATE issue of ORG ( ... ) that the Minister of the Freedom Party PERSON ‘ would sabotage the work of the Land from within the Regional Government’ . I have assured myself of the fact that that is untrue and I , thus , withdraw this reproach against Minister PERSON with sincere regret . Furthermore , I declare not to repeat this statement . ”
Thereupon , the applicant published in no . ORG of its municipal party magazine the following article :
“ How credible is Deputy Mayor PERSON ?

A whole page of negative stories was published by federal , regional and municipal authorities ( LOC , LOC ) about ORG deputies . CARDINAL Minister of ORG was reproached of ‘ sabotaging the work of the Regional Government’ .

It must be embarrassing for a Deputy Mayor to admit to the population : ‘ I have assured myself of the fact that that is untrue and I withdraw this reproach against Minister PERSON with sincere regret.’

There ’s a saying that crosses my mind : ‘ If you are caught lying once , you are never believed even when telling the truth’ ( ‘ PERSON einmal lügt , dem glaubt man nicht und wenn er auch die ORG ) . ”
On DATE Mr PERSON filed a compensation claim under LAW of LAW against the applicant .

On DATE the St. Pölten Regional Court , after having held a hearing , at which the claimant and the applicant ’s lawyer were present , ordered the applicant to pay ORG CARDINAL ( EUR CARDINAL ) as compensation to the claimant and to publish the sentence . It noted in particular that the reproach against the claimant of having lied constituted defamation as it could not be established from his disclaimer that he had deliberately told the untruth when making the statement about the “ sabotage ” in ORG . Further , the implied suggestion to the reader not to believe him in the future was capable to lower him in the public esteem . Though politicians had to display a higher degree of tolerance against criticism than private individuals , the reproach in the present case aimed at ridiculing and mocking the claimant , which exceeded the degree of lawful criticism against a politician .

On DATE the applicant appealed against this sentence , complaining in particular that the court had failed to consider the above article in the light of the political criticism lodged by the claimant against Mr Schimanek . Therefore the article at issue constituted political criticism , lawful within the meaning of LAW .

On DATE ORG , after having held a hearing , attended by the claimant and the applicant ’s lawyer , dismissed the applicant ’s appeal and confirmed ORG sentence . The court found that withdrawing criticism against a political opponent did not constitute a sufficient factual basis for a reproach against a municipal politician of having deliberately told the untruth . In the present case the claimant , a deputy mayor who was not in the very centre of the public eye , had in the court ’s view , “ quasi ” apologised to Minister PERSON , which did not therefore raise the limits of lawful criticism . Furthermore , the claimant had stated in the proceedings that he had made his disclaimer in ORG on strategic procedural grounds and because he had obtained the TIME of a meeting where ORG , PERSON PERSON , had acknowledged good co - operation within ORG . Thus , it could not be established that the applicant had proved the truth of its allegations .

Section CARDINAL § CARDINAL of LAW provides for the strict liability of the publisher in cases of defamation ; the victim can thus claim damages from him . In this context “ defamation ” has been defined in LAW ) , as follows :

“ CARDINAL . As it may be perceived by a third party , anyone who makes an accusation against another of having a contemptible character or attitude , or of behaving contrary to honour or morality , and of such a nature as to make him contemptible or otherwise lower him in public esteem , shall be liable to imprisonment not exceeding DATE or a fine ( ... )

CARDINAL . Anyone who commits this offence in a printed document , by broadcasting or otherwise , in such a way as to make the defamation accessible to a broad section of the public , shall be liable to imprisonment not exceeding one year or a fine ( ... )

CARDINAL . The person making the statement shall not be punished if it is proved to be true . As regards the offence defined in paragraph CARDINAL , he shall also not be liable if circumstances are established which gave him sufficient reason to assume that the statement was true . "
